etymology.description: semantic: 士 (upside-down ritual axe) + semantic: 呂 (two blocks of metal) + phonetic: 亼
etymology.interpretation: The character 金 combines representations of metal elements for its semantic, with 亼 indicating its pronunciation. Initially signifying copper, its meaning expanded to include all metals, and eventually gold. Although initially misunderstood as related to 王, it primarily represents the fusion of metallic concepts and sound elements.

examples.chinese: 金属(金屬)是各种材料之一。
examples.pinyin: Jīnshǔ shì gè zhǒng cáiliào zhī yī.
examples.english: Metal is one of various materials.

examples.chinese: 我的戒指是用金做的(我的戒指是用金做的)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ de jièzhǐ shì yòng jīn zuò de.
examples.english: My ring is made of gold.
